{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569694,"name":"Shishir Rajendran","username":"BluefaceBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T00:54:42.878Z","cooked":"

Hello! I am from team 7451 and we have been using vision to autoalign to the reefs using a profiled PID. We use two OV9281 cameras that are mainly targeting the reef april tags. Our calibration data is good as we have a low mean error and other accurate values for callibration. We are using advantage kits vision template along with their swerve template. We are running into an issue where the robots drive to pose is simply just not consistent with each reef. We are offset by different amounts to line up with each pole (ex: 21 cm for the right pole and 13 cm for the left, all being from the translation from the center of the april tag). This of course occurs at our home field but also at comp, not to the same degree but still off. WE have double and triple checked our transforms but to no avail. Any idea on ways to fix the vision inaccarcies and/or make it more consistent? I think my PIDs for the drive to pose aren’t the issue as its consistent for each FACE of the reef but not for each induvidual branch. I will post my repo down below. The branch we are using is called Score Commands in case you have trouble finding all the methods.

github.com

GitHub - 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025 at Score-command

Score-command

Contribute to 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Try putting your vision pose on advantage scope and see if it thinks it’s correct or it thinks it’s off by how you see it’s off. Also add a boolean for when PID reaches its setpoint. This way you know for sure if the issue is vision, PID, or something else.
